candidates.title: Were Will and Jaden Smith Killed in a Car Crash?
candidates.content:
Claim:
Actor Will Smith and his son Jaden Smith were killed in a car crash in December 2019.
Rating:
False
About this rating
In December 2019, social media users began encountering a post proclaiming that actor Will Smith and his son, rapper Jaden Smith, had "died in a crash after a "car and truck collision":
This post was a hoax, as neither Will nor Jaden Smith had died or been seriously injured in an automobile accident. Clicking through on the social media post led users to a rogue website which displayed a fake CNN video announcing the supposed "shocking" death of the Smiths (along with some other adult content):
The purpose of this hoax appeared to be to bait users into clicking to view the video as a means of driving them to malicious web pages, and to trick them into sharing the hoax post on social media in order to spread it further. Users are strongly advised not to visit to the website that underlies this hoax post and not to click on anything displayed there.
candidates.description: Fake death notices are often spread for malicious purposes.

result.explanation: The news caption is False.  Snopes.com directly debunks the claim that Will and Jaden Smith died in a car crash.  The source explicitly states that the claim was a hoax and that neither Will nor Jaden Smith died or were injured in a car accident. The source also explains that the hoax was spread through social media and linked to malicious websites.
result.supporting_points: Source 1: Snopes.com article directly refutes the claim, stating that the death reports were a hoax and neither Will nor Jaden Smith were injured or killed in a car accident.  It describes how the hoax was spread using fake social media posts that led to malicious websites.

final_result.explanation: Both internal and external validation checks strongly indicate that the original caption is out of context. The internal check finds a discrepancy between the image (showing Will and Jaden Smith together at an event) and the caption (claiming their death in a car crash).  The confidence score of 10 reflects the high certainty of this discrepancy.  The external check further reinforces this by citing a reliable source (Snopes.com) that explicitly debunks the death claim as a hoax.  The external check also achieves a confidence score of 10 due to the direct refutation from a reputable source and its detailed explanation of how the hoax was spread. There is complete agreement between the internal and external checks, both pointing towards a false and out-of-context caption. The high confidence scores from both checks (10/10) further strengthen the conclusion that the caption is inaccurate and unrelated to the image.
final_result.validation_summary: Both internal and external validations confirm the caption is out of context. The image shows Will and Jaden Smith alive, while the caption falsely reports their death in a car accident.  A reputable source debunks this claim as a hoax.
